main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.preferences

Class PropertyValues

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.preferences.PropertyValues

  • public class PropertyValues
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for reading the file config.properties which stores all of the relevant configurable data in the simulator. The path leading to config.properties has to be provided before using any of the functionalities provided by this class. For further information on the values and parameters stored in config.properties, consult the handbook for this simulator.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Constructor Detail

      • PropertyValues

        private PropertyValues()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Private constructor for a PropertyValues object, shall only be called after the function PropertyValues#setPathToConfigProperties(String) has been used. Without a path to such a file, the program DOES NOT WORK.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if config.properties can not be found and/or read.

    • Method Detail

      • setPathToResourceDirectory

        public static void setPathToResourceDirectory(java.lang.String pathToResourceDir)
        This class does not know inherently where to find the config.properties file on the file system. It does also not know, where the important resource directory is located. That directory is important, because it is used as a point of reference for the relative paths in config.properties pointing to the key directory, the storage directory and many more. Because of this the user has to tell the class where the resource directory is located on the file system, so this class may then construct the necessary absolute paths to config.properties and the other files.
        Important: this function has to be called before ever using PropertyValues.
        Parameters:
        pathToResourceDir - the absolute path to the directory containing config.properties, userlist.properties, storage, persistentStorage and keys.
        Should not end with a path separator character (e.g. / or \)

      • getInstance

        public static PropertyValues getInstance()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Fetches the single instance of a PropertyValues object that is allowed to exist. If none exist yet, this creates the first one through the usage of the private constructor.
        Returns:
        the PropertyValues object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if PropertyValues#loadConfigFile(String) throws such an Exception
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadConfigFile

        private void loadConfigFile()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to load the configuration file located inside the directory provided via setPathToResourceDirectory(String). The configuration file has to be named ConfigConstants.CFG_NAME, otherwise it will not be found. The configuration file stores every important parameter of the simulator that can be configured, for example which key to use and where the certificates are located.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file does not exist and/or can not be read.
        Since:
        1.5

      • getPathToUserlistProperties

        public java.lang.String getPathToUserlistProperties()
        Getter for the absolute path to the file userlist.properties. This expects the file storing the user list to be located inside the resource directory set by setPathToResourceDirectory(String) and to be named according to the name found in the config.properties file under the tag ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_PATH_TO_USERLIST_PROPERTIES.
        IMPORTANT: should only be used after setPathToResourceDirectory(String) has been called once.
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the file storing the user list, most likely named userlist.properties

      • getPathToKeyDir

        public java.lang.String getPathToKeyDir()
        Getter for the absolute path to the directory denoted by ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_KEY_DIR in config.properties. This expects the directory to be a child directory of the resources directory, set by setPathToResourceDirectory(String). The returned path ends with the name of the key directory, not with a path separator character (e.g. / or \).
        IMPORTANT: should only be used after setPathToResourceDirectory(String) has been called once.
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the directory containing the keys and certificates for the TSE simulator

      • getPathToPrivateKey

        public java.lang.String getPathToPrivateKey()
        Getter for the absolute path to the private key file used in the simulator. This expects the file containing the private key to be located inside a directory denoted by ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_KEY_DIR that is located inside the resources directory. The name of the private key should match the one denoted by ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_PRIV_KEY.
        IMPORTANT: should only be used after setPathToResourceDirectory(String) has been called once.
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the private key of the TSE simulator

      • getPathToNormalStorage

        public java.lang.String getPathToNormalStorage()
        Getter for the absolute path to the directory denoted by ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_PATH_TO_STORAGE in config.properties. This expects the directory to be a child directory of the resources directory, set by setPathToResourceDirectory(String). The returned path ends with the name of the storage directory, not with a path separator character (e.g. / or \).
        IMPORTANT: should only be used after setPathToResourceDirectory(String) has been called once.
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the directory used as the normal storage of the TSE simulator. Normal in that context means, the storage where everything targetable by SEAPI.deleteStoredData() is stored.

      • getPathToPersistentStorage

        public java.lang.String getPathToPersistentStorage()
        Getter for the absolute path to the directory denoted by ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_PATH_TO_PERSISTENT_STORAGE in config.properties. This expects the directory to be a child directory of the resources directory, set by setPathToResourceDirectory(String). The returned path ends with the name of the persistent storage directory, not with a path separator character (e.g. / or \).
        IMPORTANT: should only be used after setPathToResourceDirectory(String) has been called once.
        Returns:
        the absolute path to the directory used as persistent storage for the TSE simulator.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the value corresponding to the key it has received.
        Parameters:
        key - searches for the value corresponding to the key in the Properties object that is created by reading from the config.properties file
        Returns:
        the value corresponding to the key or null if config.properties does not contain such a key.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAllPropertyNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllPropertyNames()
        Gets all the keys and packs them into a String Set.
        Returns:
        a set containing all the keys currently associated with this PropertyValues instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Checks if the String key is used as a key
        Parameters:
        key - the supposed key as a String
        Returns:
        true, if the key String is used as a key in config.properties
        Since:
        1.0

      • getConstantsAlgorithmName

        public java.lang.String getConstantsAlgorithmName()
        A method to get the name of the currently used algorithm in the format that is used in Constants. This String can then be used as a key to the HashMap in the same class to get the OID of that algorithm. This method prevents each class that has to know the algorithm OID from building it on its own.
        IMPORTANT: before using this method, the caller has to make sure, an instance of PropertyValues exists, otherwise this method does not know how to load it.
        Returns:
        the name of the signature algorithm in the format ALGORITHM_PLAIN_HASH_HASHLENGTH where ALGORITHM is ECDSA or ECSDSA, HASH is SHA or SHA3 and HASHLENGTH is 256, 384 or 512.
        Since:
        1.5
